snippet: Battles in Tripoli and Benghazi forced the leaders to meet in Tobruk as they sought to prove “that Libya is not a failed country.”
abstract: Libyan leaders are forced to convene Parliamentary session in relatively stable eastern port of Tobruk in effort to keep country from spiraling out of control further than it already has; battles among militias are raging in capital city of Tripoli and in Benghazi; senior Egyptian official suggests his country might intervene in Libya militarily if calm cannot be restored.

byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway contributed reporting from Tunis.

lead_paragraph: Battles in Tripoli and Benghazi forced the leaders to meet in Tobruk as they sought to prove “that Libya is not a failed country.”

headline.main: In Libya, Parliament Convenes Amid Battles
headline.print_headline: In Libya, Parliament Convenes Amid Battles
